alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Donley; Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 1:19AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Armstrong, south central Gray and Donley Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 119 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Howardwick, or 8 miles north of Clarendon, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarendon, Howardwick, Hedley, Lelia Lake, Lake Mcclellan, Alanreed and Greenbelt Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
